page.title: 16 RAILWAY_ MAUD JUNCTION
page.content: The London & North Eastern railway station used to be the main part of local activity.Five trains each way per day brought papers & post, commercial travellers & calves. Maud was the junction where the carriages from Aberdeen split into two sections one heading for Peterhead & the other for Fraserburgh with goods sidings too, a bookstall & refreshment rooms. Now Willowherb grows out of the platform, broom & snowberry bushes encroach on the one time track.The station buildings are boarded up & used by children as hutties to play in. The railway came to Maud in 1870 and the Station Hotel was built at about this time.It has been owned by a Hendry for about a 100 years.The railway closed in 1963 for passengers and goods trains stopped in 1978.
